sen.j: 弁官（べんかん、辨官）は、朝廷の最高機関、太政官の職である左大弁（さだいべん）・右大弁（うだいべん）・左中弁（さちゅうべん）・右中弁（うちゅうべん）・左少弁（さしょうべん）・右少弁（うしょうべん）の総称である。
sen.e: Benkan collectively means the posts of Daijokan, which is the highest organization of the Imperial Court, Sadaiben, Udaiben, Sachuben, Uchuben, Sashoben, and Ushoben.
Benkan collectively means the posts of Sadaiben, Udaiben, Sachuben, Uchuben, Sashoben, and Ushoben in Daijokan which is the highest organization of the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 通説においては四等官の中の判官（じょう）に相当するが、異説として弁官を含めた弁官局を太政官の別局として捉え、元は本来の四等官の系列には含まない品官であったする説もある。
sen.e: It is commonly accepted that Benkan corresponds to Jo among the four official ranks, but there is another opinion that the bureau Benkankyoku was established separately from Daijokan and Benkan was originally Honkan, which was not included in the system of four official ranks.

sen.j: 大弁は従四位上、中弁は正五位下相当（大宝令官位令）。
sen.e: Daiben corresponded to Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, and Chuben corresponded to Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade (Taihorei Kanirei.)

sen.j: 定員は左右の大弁・中弁・少弁各1名の合計6名であるが、中弁・少弁において合計2名まで権官の設置が許されて「八弁」と称された。
sen.e: The prescribed number of Benkan was six as it was one for each of Daiben, Chuben, Shoben from the left (Sa) and the right (U), but as provisional posts were permitted up to two for each of Chuben and Shoben, it was called 'Eight Ben.'
